intro: Cracca exigua, commonly known as the slender cracca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has a compact growth habit with small, oval leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
